DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study test feasibility measure body composition air displacement plethysmography ( ADP ) rapidly grow , medically stable late gestation [ 32-35 week post-menstrual age ( PMA ) ] premature infant .
DOC.brief_title: Neuroendocrine Mechanisms Growth Body Composition Preterm Term Infants
DOC.detailed_description: 1 . To assess feasibility measure body fat deposition ADP medically stable late gestation ( 32-35 week ) , premature infant period rapid postnatal growth . 2 . To test relationship % BF ADP % BF DXA , well characterize relationship fat measure bone measure quantitative ultrasound serum level insulin , IGF-1 , IGF bind protein , adiponectin leptin . 3 . To perform inter- intra-rater test anthropometric , ultrasound , ADP measurement . 4 . Compare growth , body composition bone strength infant born preterm infant bear full term .
DOC.criteria: Infants bear 32 4/7 35 3/7 week gestation 37 4/7 42 3/7 week gestation , physical exam birth Birth weight 5th 95th percentile correct gestational age Chromosomal abnormality Major congenital anomaly Major surgery Severe CNS injury Inborn error metabolism Assisted ventilation Inability start enteral feed 96 hour age
